trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref> class initiates a search operation.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref> class.
This constructor creates an empty request.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchScope,System.String[])"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref> class using the specified name, search filter, scope, and attributes.
The distinguished name of the object at which to start the search.
An LDAP search filter.
One of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchScope"></xref> that specifies the search scope.
An array that contains the requested attributes in the result set.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchScope,System.String[])"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref> class using the specified name, search filter, scope, and attributes.
The distinguished name of the object for which to search.
A DSML v2 search filter.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchScope"></xref> value that specifies the search scope.
The default value is <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchScope"></xref>.
An array that contains the requested attributes in the result set.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.Aliases"></xref> property contains one of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DereferenceAlias"></xref> that specifies the dereference alias behavior.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DereferenceAlias"></xref> value that specifies the dereference alias behavior.
The value is not a member of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DereferenceAlias"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.Attributes"></xref> property contains the attributes of the requested object.
The attributes of the requested object.
Set this property to `null` to retrieve all attributes.
One of the strings in <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection"></xref> object is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.DistinguishedName"></xref> property contains the distinguished name of the requested object.
The distinguished name of the requested object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.Filter"></xref> property contains the search filter.
The search filter.
If the value is a string, this property is an LDAP search filter.
If the value is an XML document, the property is a DSML v2 search filter.
Any other type throws an exception.
The value is not a string or an XML document.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.Scope"></xref> property contains one of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope"></xref> that specifies the scope of the search.
One of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope"></xref> that specifies the scope of the search.
The value is not a member of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.SizeLimit"></xref> property contains the maximum number of objects returned in the search request.
The maximum number of objects returned in the search request.
The value is less than zero.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.TimeLimit"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the time span allowed, if the server processes the search request.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the time span allowed, if the server processes the search request.
The value is less than <xref href="System.TimeSpan.Zero"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.ToXmlNode(System.Xml.XmlDocument)"></xref> method creates an XML node from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
The resulting <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest.TypesOnly"></xref> property specifies whether the search returns only the attribute names and not the attribute values.
If this property is `true`, the search returns only the attribute names.
If this property is `false`, the search returns both the attribute names and values.
